name: Description of project
text_content: This section of documentation contains upper overview of project

children.name: Naming
children.text_content:
PROJECT NAME:  NEW PROJECT
PROJECT CODENAME: CODENAME_EMPTY

children.name: Resources
children.text_content:
The main folders in the /resources directory are:
- /Data
- /Images
- /Styles

### Images subfolders

#### Background images (resources/Images/backgrounds)
These are the backgrounds for different pages or sections of your website. They should be named according to the section they're displayed on. For example, if there's a hero image at the top of the homepage, its file could be called `home_hero.jpg`.

#### GUI textures


### Styles
CSS stylesheets go here. The main CSS file is usually called `main.css` but can vary depending on how the project is set up.

### Data
Any data files that are required by the application such as CSV, JSON, XML etc.

children.name: main.css
children.text_content:
FILE: resources/styles/main.css
TYPE: CSS
DESCRIPTION: This file contains the main style definitions for the Graphical User Interface (GUI) in PySide6. It defines colors, fonts, sizes, and other visual elements that are used throughout the application.

Style should use modern fonts.
Dark background.
Futuristic.

Elements: 

title
button
panel
textbox

INTERFACE: none
USES: none

children.name: image style: image_style_icon
children.text_content:
PROMPT: ui icon, flat style, black on white, <lora:icon1p1_xl:0.7> 
NEGATIVE PROMPT: bad quality

children.name: image style: image_style_default
children.text_content:
PROMPT: cyberpunk, 8k
NEGATIVE PROMPT: bad quality, corrupted text

children.name: sketch.css
children.text_content:
FILE: resources/styles/sketch.css
TYPE: CSS
DESCRIPTION: This CSS file defines the styling for generating black on white sketch versions of elements, primarily used for creating wireframe masks. It ensures that all elements have a high contrast between their fill color and stroke color, allowing for easy identification during design iterations.


file contains style for following base object types (w/o class point): 
 panel
 label
 textbox 
 button

and following class styles:
 .title                      
 .subtitle               
 .caption 
 .comment


we need to define border style 
margins, paddings
font and font-size




INTERFACE: N/A
PROMPT: Generate a CSS file with appropriate selectors and rules for creating a sketchy, black on white appearance.
LINKS: r4.files.sec3.2.4
USES: N/A

children.name: image style: image_style_ui
children.text_content:
PROMPT: abstract background, dark fancy modern futurstic (ui style:1.1) with  controls, textboxes. checkboxes, panels, toolpanel, progress bar in different states normal, hovered, clicked, (flat clean ui:1.2), almost black background, white and teal elements, yellow accents, white text <lora:SDXL_Black_Sa_May:1> <lora:slide1_xl:1> slide
NEGATIVE PROMPT: ugly, blurry, scribble, chopped-off, bloom effect, (Wookiee), small sketches, (amateur), ((blurry:1.4)), bad quality, worse quality, jpg, compressed image, 3d


Not used drafts for prompts:

modern ui interface, cyberpunk, 8k, cyberpunk 2077 colors <lora:SDXL_Black_Sa_May:1> <lora:slide1_xl:1> slide


abstract background, dark fancy modern futurstic (ui style sheet:1.1) with  controls, textboxes. checkboxes, panels, toolpanel, progress bar in different states normal, hovered, clicked, (flat clean ui:1.2), almost black background, white and teal elements, yellow accents, white text <lora:SDXL_Black_Sa_May:1> cyberpunk wall geometric pattern decor <lora:slide1_xl:1> slide

watermark, wallpaper, ugly, blurry, scribble, chopped-off, bloom effect, (Wookiee), small sketches, (amateur), ((blurry:1.4)), bad quality, worse quality, jpg, compressed image, 3d

children.text_content:
Folder resources/fonts contains custom fonts:

children.name: Additional utilities
children.text_content:
The additional utilities are a set of tools that can be helpful in various situations when working with the project. They include scripts for generating documentation, running tests, or performing other tasks related to the project. These utilities should be written in Python and placed in the `utils` directory within the project repository.

The list of utilities see in subsections
